thoughts.text: I will use the execute_shell command to search for how to obtain a valid API key for the Google Maps API using the "curl" command to make a GET request to the Google Maps Platform documentation website.
thoughts.reasoning: The execute_shell command with the "curl" command can be used to make a GET request to the Google Maps Platform documentation website, which should provide information on how to obtain a valid API key for the Google Maps API.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the execute_shell command with the "curl" command to make a GET request to the Google Maps Platform documentation website
- Find a reliable source of information on how to obtain a valid API key
- Obtain a valid API key for the Google Maps API
- Use the execute_python_file command to run the Python file that uses the Google Maps API to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail
- Plan my adventure accordingly, including what time to leave and how long to spend on the trail
thoughts.criticism: I need to make sure that I am accounting for traffic and other potential delays when calculating the travel time to the hiking trail.
thoughts.speak: I will use the execute_shell command with the "curl" command to make a GET request to the Google Maps Platform documentation website.
